capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role requires working as part of a team in field operations, emphasizing teamwork and collaboration.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Effective communication across cultures is essential, especially given the role's focus on Aboriginal cultural knowledge and connections.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Understanding and respecting Aboriginal cultural issues are critical for this role.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: The role involves planning and prioritizing tasks such as pest and weed control, fire management, and maintenance of parks and facilities.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Problem-solving skills are necessary for leading operations and addressing issues in the field.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: The role requires adherence to safety standards and environmental regulations, demonstrating accountability.

capabilities.name: Display Resilience and Courage
capabilities.description: Field officers must be resilient and courageous, especially in challenging outdoor conditions and during firefighting duties.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: Self-management is crucial for working independently or with minimal supervision in remote locations.

skills.name: Cultural Competency
skills.description: Ability to communicate and work effectively across cultures, particularly with Aboriginal communities.

skills.name: Safety and Equipment Operation
skills.description: Skills in safely operating and maintaining a range of plant and equipment, including firefighting tools.

skills.name: Environmental Conservation Techniques
skills.description: Knowledge of and ability to apply techniques for pest and weed control, and environmental conservation.

generalRole.title: Environmental Field Officer (Aboriginal Identified)
generalRole.description: This role focuses on hands-on field operations to maintain and improve national parks, with a significant emphasis on Aboriginal cultural knowledge and environmental conservation.
